{"id": "49503", "title": "Connectors do not bind to ports in Catalina.load() and only later in start()", 
"description": "Testing with trunk at revision 957942, thus this supposedly affects version 7.0.0 as well. In TC6, there is a separate prestartup phase when starting Tomcat, allowing Connectors to bind to their ports before other parts of Tomcat are started. This is implemented by having separate methods Bootstrap.load(String[]) and Boot.start() [1]. However, it seems that this implementation breaks the fix for BZ 48625. To reproduce this issue, follow the steps below:
1. Start the first instance successfully.

OB: The Connectors do not bind to their ports in the Catalina.load() method.

EB: The Connectors should bind to their ports in the Catalina.load() method.

SR: Add the following line to conf/catalina.properties
org.apache.catalina.startup.EXITONINITFAILURE=true

2. Start two Tomcat instances with the same configuration at the same time.", 
"OB": "The Connectors do not bind to their ports in the Catalina.load() method.", 
"EB": "The Connectors should bind to their ports in the Catalina.load() method.", 
"SR": "Add the following line to conf/catalina.properties
org.apache.catalina.startup.EXITONINITFAILURE=true

2. Start two Tomcat instances with the same configuration at the same time."}
